statement.tex: \\ \text{Let } \\ \qquad z_1 = a-\iota b = R_1\cdot e^{\iota\theta_1}\text{ and }\\ \qquad z_2 = c-\iota d = R_2\cdot e^{\iota\theta_2}. \\ \text{Given this, is the following correct?}
\\ \textbf{Generally speaking }\text{if }z = x + \iota y = R\cdot e^{\iota\theta},\\ \text{then what is }\overline{z}\text{ equal to?}

options.tex: \begin{align} x-\iota y &= \sqrt{\dfrac{R_1}{R_2}}\cdot e^{\left(\frac{\theta_1-\theta_2}{2}\right)\iota} \\ \implies x+\iota y &= \sqrt{\dfrac{R_1}{R_2}}\cdot e^{\left(\frac{\theta_2-\theta_1}{2}\right)\iota} \\ \implies (x-\iota y)\cdot (x+\iota y) &= \sqrt{\dfrac{R_1}{R_2}}\cdot e^{\left(\frac{\theta_1-\theta_2}{2}\right)\iota}\\ &\times\sqrt{\dfrac{R_1}{R_2}}\cdot e^{\left(\frac{\theta_2-\theta_1}{2}\right)\iota} \\ &= \dfrac{R_1}{R_2}\cdot e^{\frac{\theta_1-\theta_2+\theta_2-\theta_1}{2}\iota} \\ \implies x^2 + y^2 &= \dfrac{R_1}{R_2} = \sqrt{\dfrac{a^2+b^2}{c^2+d^2}} \\ \implies (x^2+y^2)^2 &= \dfrac{a^2+b^2}{c^2+d^2} \end{align}
